A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Should be called STAR WARS: Deus Ex Machina.  
  

With this episode\, Star Wars as we know and love it is now completely dead. Explosions\, action scenes and impassioned speeches abound\, but you'd be hard pressed to find a point for any of it. Many scenes seem to be paying homage to iconic scenes from the original trilogy\, but recreating the form without retaining the spirit and purpose makes those scenes seem more like cheap imitations instead.  

On top of all that\, there is simply no sense of actual tension or urgency in this movie. Characters seem to make decisions based not on the needs of the situation they're in\, but on how flashy\, dramatic\, or touching they can make their situation look in front of an audience. It's jarring\, and makes it very apparent that we are being served something on a big screen in 2017 USA instead of being pulled in to a galaxy far\, far away.   

There were a few good scenes here and there\, and a few poignant moments as well. Unfortunately\, for the majority of the movie you're just left wondering\, "but why though?" It's sad to say\, but this is easily the worst Star Wars movie to date.
